==German== {{slim-wikipedia|lang=de}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|ūzlender}}, derived from {{m|gmh|ūzlant||outlying fields}}. Modern German {{m|de|Ausland||foreign countries}} is a backformation from ''Ausländer.'' Compare archaic {{cog|nl|uitlander}}, {{cog|en|outlandish}}, {{m|en|outlander}}, {{cog|da|udlænding}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈaʊ̯sˌlɛndɐ/|[ˈʔaʊ̯sˌlɛndɐ]}} * {{audio|de|De-Ausländer.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m|Ausländers|Ausländer|f=Ausländerin}} # {{lb|de|properly}} [[foreigner]]; foreign [[national]], regardless of [[descent]] (male or of unspecified sex) # {{lb|de|informal|common speech}} [[allochthone]] person, regardless of [[nationality]] (male or of unspecified sex) ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|s}} ====Antonyms==== * {{l|de|Inländer}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Ausländerei}} * {{l|de|ausländerfeindlich}} * {{l|de|Ausländerin}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|Ausland}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
